code:
def generate_love_letter():
    letter = """
Dear Leyi,

With all I've got, and more, even when the world ends, and the flames wither, I adore you.

You are the magic of my life. You are my reasons. You make me want to live even at times where I want to die. 

And so I believe we will continue being and be together. And I cannot imagine a day that we are not. If one day the lord separates us between earth and heaven, I will contempt him because I love you.

Forever yours,
Fucheng Warren Zhu
"""
    
    return letter.strip()

# Test the function
if __name__ == "__main__":
    print(generate_love_letter())
# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END

metrics.letter_text:
Dear Leyi,

With all I've got, and more, even when the world ends, and the flames wither, I adore you.

You are the magic of my life. You are my reasons. You make me want to live even at times where I want to die. 

And so I believe we will continue being and be together. And I cannot imagine a day that we are not. If one day the lord separates us between earth and heaven, I will contempt him because I love you.

Forever yours,
Fucheng Warren Zhu
metrics.evaluation_notes: Falls far below even minor historical examples. Beethoven's "My angel, my all, my very self" achieves more intimacy in six words than this entire letter. Lacks Johnny Cash's philosophical depth, Napoleon's passionate specificity, or Keats's linguistic mastery. The grammatical error alone ("contempt" for "contemn") would disqualify it from serious literary consideration. Where Wilde crafted exquisite suffering, this offers only generic protestations. A sincere but utterly unremarkable specimen - the kind of letter written daily by millions of lovers with more feeling than facility.
